messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Who would be good for an interview?
messages.msgSnippet: Linda Hessel s a local (to me) mama with 4 school-aged kids. Holly thought her house was paradise ;) Her girls are often featured on my blog

> anyway, so this is an opportunity to do good without being attacked
> for it! Woohoo!

> It should be someone who's articulate and also actually would be
> willing to do this. It would be probably just a very short question
> or two, and it pays nothing. Exciting, I know.

messages.subject: Who would be good for an interview?
messages.msgSnippet: I need to recommend someone in the U.S.  who is currently unschooling (kids of school age, at least two) and has Skype, for something that might never be
messages.messageBody:
I need to recommend someone in the U.S. who is currently unschooling
(kids of school age, at least two) and has Skype, for something that
might never be aired.

A little vague; sorry.

May 11, a Tuesday, there is a pilot being made for a possible new talk
show for mothers. They're doing a piece on unschooling. It might
never actually be on TV, but a fair number of people will see it
anyway, so this is an opportunity to do good without being attacked
for it! Woohoo!

It should be someone who's articulate and also actually would be
willing to do this. It would be probably just a very short question
or two, and it pays nothing. Exciting, I know.

Volunteers might be okay, but recommendations would be nice too.

Sandra
